description: Cyclotomic fields with class number 1 (or with unique factorization).
comments: Note that if n == 2 (mod 4) Q(zeta_n) is the same field as Q(zeta_{n/2}), so this sequence omits numbers that are 2 mod 4. - Yuval Dekel, Jun 07 2003
references: F. Le Lionnais, Les Nombres Remarquables. Paris: Hermann, p. 85, 1983.
J. M. Masley, Where are the number fields with small class number?, pp. 221-242 of Number Theory Carbondale 1979, Lect. Notes Math. 751 (1982).
P. Ribenboim, The Book of Prime Number Records. Springer-Verlag, NY, 2nd ed., 1989, p. 259.
N. J. A. Sloane and Simon Plouffe, The Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences, Academic Press, 1995 (includes this sequence).
Alf van der Poorten, Notes on Fermat's Last Theorem, Wiley, 1996, p. 14.
L. C. Washington, Introduction to Cyclotomic Fields, Springer, p. 353.
links: M. Baake and U. Grimm, A note on shelling
E. Bugarin, M. de las Peñas, D. Frettlöh, Perfect colourings of cyclotomic integers (2009).
J. M. Masley and Hugh L. Montgomery, Cyclotomic fields with unique factorization, J. Reine Angew. Math. 286/287 (1976), 248-256.
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_.
